raw:
{
  "items": [
    {
      "prompt": "Define the term 'neuron'.",
      "max": 2,
      "markscheme": [
        "A neuron is a specialized cell that transmits nerve impulses.",
        "Neurons are the basic building blocks of the nervous system."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Identify two types of neurotransmitters.",
      "max": 2,
      "markscheme": [
        "Dopamine",
        "Serotonin",
        "Acetylcholine",
        "Norepinephrine"
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Outline two functions of the autonomic nervous system.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "Regulates involuntary bodily functions such as heart rate.",
        "Controls the fight or flight response.",
        "Manages digestion and respiratory rate.",
        "Regulates glandular activity."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Outline two differences between the central nervous system and the peripheral nervous system.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "The central nervous system consists of the brain and spinal cord.",
        "The peripheral nervous system includes all the nerves outside the central nervous system.",
        "The central nervous system processes information, while the peripheral nervous system transmits signals to and from the body.",
        "The central nervous system is encased in bone, while the peripheral nervous system is not."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain how the structure of a neuron relates to its function.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "Neurons have dendrites that receive signals from other neurons, facilitating communication.",
        "The axon transmits electrical impulses away from the cell body, allowing for signal propagation.",
        "Myelin sheaths insulate the axon, speeding up the transmission of impulses.",
        "Synaptic terminals release neurotransmitters to communicate with other neurons."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain the role of the hypothalamus in the endocrine system with an example.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "The hypothalamus regulates the release of hormones from the pituitary gland.",
        "For example, it controls the release of cortisol during stress.",
        "It maintains homeostasis by regulating body temperature and hunger.",
        "The hypothalamus links the nervous system to the endocrine system."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain the process of synaptic transmission.",
      "max": 6,
      "markscheme": [
        "An action potential travels down the axon to the synaptic terminal.",
        "Neurotransmitters are released into the synaptic cleft.",
        "These neurotransmitters bind to receptors on the postsynaptic neuron.",
        "If the threshold is reached, a new action potential is generated in the postsynaptic neuron.",
        "The neurotransmitters are then either reabsorbed or broken down.",
        "This process allows for communication between neurons."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain the concept of plasticity in the brain.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "Plasticity refers to the brain's ability to change and adapt as a result of experience.",
        "For example, learning a new skill can strengthen neural connections.",
        "It can also involve the brain reorganizing itself after injury.",
        "Plasticity is crucial for recovery and adaptation throughout life."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Identify two methods used to study the brain.",
      "max": 2,
      "markscheme": [
        "Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (fMRI)",
        "Electroencephalography (EEG)",
        "Positron Emission Tomography (PET)",
        "Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)"
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Outline two ethical considerations in brain research.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "Informed consent must be obtained from participants.",
        "Participants should have the right to withdraw at any time.",
        "Confidentiality of participants' data must be maintained.",
        "Minimizing harm to participants is essential."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain the role of the amygdala in emotional processing.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "The amygdala is involved in the detection of emotional stimuli.",
        "It plays a key role in fear responses and emotional memory.",
        "For example, it activates during threatening situations.",
        "The amygdala helps in forming emotional memories associated with experiences."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Explain how the endocrine system interacts with the nervous system.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "The endocrine system releases hormones that affect bodily functions.",
        "The nervous system can trigger hormone release in response to stimuli.",
        "For example, stress activates the hypothalamus, leading to cortisol release.",
        "This interaction helps maintain homeostasis and respond to changes."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Identify two functions of the spinal cord.",
      "max": 2,
      "markscheme": [
        "Transmits signals between the brain and the rest of the body.",
        "Coordinates reflex actions."
      ]
    },
    {
      "prompt": "Outline two ways in which the brain can adapt to injury.",
      "max": 4,
      "markscheme": [
        "Neurogenesis, the creation of new neurons, can occur.",
        "Reorganization of existing neural pathways can take place.",
        "Compensatory mechanisms may develop to regain lost functions
